thread.title: Super Bowl 51: Tom Brady's pick-six, in frame-by-frame dejection
thread.title_full: Super Bowl 51: Tom Brady's pick-six, in frame-by-frame dejection

author: Sporting News (customerservice@sportingnews.com)
title: Super Bowl 51: Tom Brady's pick-six, in frame-by-frame dejection
text:
February 5, 2017 9:11pm EST February 5, 2017 9:09pm EST Tom Brady threw the first pick-six of his playoff career, and unfortunately for him, the cameras had every angle covered. Tom Brady, Robert Alford (Getty Images) Sporting news 
Updated at 9:11 p.m. ET 
Updated at 9:11 p.m. ET 
Before Super Bowl 51, we had rarely seen Tom Brady embarrassed in his playoff career. That changed with one throw and interception return â€” and something that somewhat resembled a tackle attempt from the GOAT. 
With the Patriots down 14-0 and trying to rally late in the second half, Brady threw an interception to Robert Alford, who scampered for an 82-yard pick-six. 
That not only put the Patriots down in a three-touchdown hole, but it was also the first pick-6 of Brady's postseason career, a total of 34 games. 
Unfortunately for Brady, the cameras were there to catch every angle of his whiff in painstaking detail ( all photos Getty Images ): Watch This
